name: Gentiana
description: Gentiana is a large genus of about 400 species in the family Gentianaceae, distributed around the world. These plants grow in a wide variety of habitats and occur on all continents except the Antarctica.They have trumpet-shaped, bright colored flowers on short stalks. The flowers have 4 or 5 sepals and also the same number of stamens and petals. They are great for cut flowers and flower arrangements.
meaning: The genus was named after King Gentius of Illyria (180-167 B.C.), the last Illyrian King who discovered the medicinal benefits of Gentiana.
color_description: Most of the species have beautiful, vivid blue flowers, but white, yellow, purple and red varieties are also available.
